result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad William Magle

records.addlTxt:
9:21 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Chad William Magle, Defendant Chad William Magle in court. INCLUDES 22CM319 and 22TR1117.  Atty. Satorius notes a NG was entered previously on 22TR1117 but was defaulted. Court sets aside default judgment and reenters NG plea. Atty. Satorius states there are not blood results yet. ADA Becker states he believes it could be 4-5 months before results are received. Court sets additional PSC. Adjourned: 9:26 AM. kma
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

01:53 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker, DF ATTY: Travis Satorius for today, DF:  Chad William Magle appeared. INCLUDES 22CM319 and 22TR1117. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. NG. Waives speedy trial. 22TR1117: NG plea entered. State requests bond. Atty. Satorius makes bond argument. Court orders bond. Court sets SETC and PSC. Adjourned: 1:57 PM. kma  Settlement conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
